title: Lost a 1v1 against a hecarim, as a fed darius.
body:
Can someone Replay.GG  my last game as darius on the account ''Defended''

It just doesnt work for me for some reason.

It was around the 25 minute mark i fought a hec who wasent as fed, but had baron.

Lost a 1v1 against him and landed every Q.

I'd like to see it tbh


edit; he looked pretty even in gold

Makes no sense. Darius counters hecarim pretty heavily, nevermind the fact that you were fed.

I'm calling bullshit on your supposed perfect micro. Either that or you had some shit tier build, I'll see if I can find it but Im on my ipad right now so I dont think I can view the video.

Yea but looking at both of their builds, assuming darius had the cleaver, randuins, and deadmans at that point, it wouldn't matter what hecarim had, he has been outscaled permanently in dueling scenarios.

I will be able to view the video once I get home, but the OP isn't sharing the full story or he really fucked up hard and just doesnt want to admit it/he doesnt see it. The OP said he was fed, and it's possible to "farm champions" with a lot of roaming which gives a lot of gold but not a lot of experience, allowing hecarim to get a sizable level lead if he was farming instead of trying to skirmish and kill people.

Baron is a sizable buff, but not ridicilous enough to really tip the matchup in hecarim's favor. Hec's team also got a bunch of drakes while the OP had none, fire drakes would help to further skew the battle if they made up any part of the drake advantage.

EDIT

Although I couldnt see the video, the OP laned against an AD top lane and an AD jungle, and yet he bought spirit visage before buying randuins, he completed randuins at the 32 minute mark, after the duel. That in and of itself is a pretty huge fuck up. I understand that there is a twisted fate, but why the hell delay randuins for spirit visage when your lane opponent and the jungler are both heavily AD? Not to mention, the OP doesn't know how to or refused to farm up like an intelligent league of legends player. No game should end with a jungler having equivalent farm to a solo laner. The fact that hecarim had only one cs less than darius at the end of the game is a red flag.

At 30 minutes the OP had {{item:3742}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3065}} {{item:1011}}

Hecarim had {{item:3078}} {{item:3009}} {{item:1401}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3742}} 

Upon further checking, here was another red light.

The OP went W over E max. Oh boy... What is this? Season 4? Holy shit. Max E over W always. The OP was missing out on incredibly valuable free armor pen against a bruiser. Cmon, first grade darius tips here.

Also, OP ran stormraiders surge while hecarim went SoTA, so the keynote advantage goes heavily to hecarim. Stormraiders is a terrible keynote on darius when fighting against other durable opponents, especially if you're going to derp and max W over E so you miss out on armor pen.

And the veterans scars over runic armor... No scale, no scale at all. Pure early game, fall off like a brick.

I mean i have around 180 games as Darius. i have an adc background so kiting with phage while using the Q Efficiently is no problem for me ( you can watch the replay and see how i laned and comment on that )

My problem with Darius is that despite people complaining about him a lot, im actually surprised at how low his damage can be when hes hitting something that has any armor.

By the time you rack up 5 stacks on a maokai/trundle/nautilus, you are either dead from the adc or your team is dead.

My point is i just dont appreciate his damage after lane on targets with armor. I feel like its extremely questionable.

But that could be because i max W second and not E.

I'm also using attack speed Quints i see a lot of people use AD quints

I cant remember the math exactly, but with cleaver and max e, you can negate a little under half of an enemy's total armor. With that in mind, that's why you should max e first (nvm the 3 second cd reduction on your biggest anti kite and only hard cc ability).

The damage you do to tanks in comparison to an adc is lower, but when you compare yourself to other frontliners youll be amazed at what darius can do. In any case, Late game is about five stacking a tank and moving towards the backline, not fighting the tank after five stacks.
